intro: Edwardia gabonensis, commonly known as the Gabon sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Montiniaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has a low-growing, mat-forming habit. Its leaves are fleshy and adapted to store water, which helps it survive in its humid, tropical habitat. Edwardia gabonensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
